conclusion: The task is to predict whether liquid will flow into container E or F after passing through baffles.
There are four openings labeled A, B, C, and D at the top of the image where liquid can flow out.
There are baffles of various colors and orientations inside the container that will direct the flow of liquid.
At the bottom of the image, there are two containers labeled E and F where the liquid can collect.
The baffles are angled in such a way that they can direct liquid either to the left or right.
The opening A is positioned above a red baffle angled downward to the right.
The opening B is positioned above a black baffle angled downward to the left.
The opening C is positioned above a purple baffle angled downward to the right.
The opening D is positioned above a pink baffle angled downward to the left.
Liquid from opening A will hit the red baffle and be directed to the right.
Liquid from opening B will hit the black baffle and be directed to the left.
Liquid from opening C will hit the purple baffle and be directed to the right.
Liquid from opening D will hit the pink baffle and be directed to the left.
Liquid directed to the right from openings A and C will eventually flow into container F.
Liquid directed to the left from openings B and D will eventually flow into container E.
The final prediction is that liquid will flow into both containers E and F.
